messages: 07133226947cf78c9e6ff93ee07f7e9f (17:13): how do i split vim, in diff mode, horizontally instead of vertically?
13d7d168f19c177db483c695588e476c (17:15): do you mind changing it every time or do you want a fix?
13d7d168f19c177db483c695588e476c (17:15): Ctrl-W K will make the current window split go up to the top
13d7d168f19c177db483c695588e476c (17:15): these are captial J and K whereas lowercase moves your cursor
13d7d168f19c177db483c695588e476c (17:16): that's the default, you wanted horizontal
07133226947cf78c9e6ff93ee07f7e9f (17:16): the first two were right by the way ;D
13d7d168f19c177db483c695588e476c (17:17): they're right but they don't do anything for you right off
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:33): Using vim, how do I split long lines into several shorter lines (of 80 or 78 chars width), without making two adjacent lines wrap one after the other.
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:35): praetis: I already have the file written.
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:35): praetis: now I want to reformat it.
13d7d168f19c177db483c695588e476c (17:35): well you could make a recording
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:35): praetis: it was generated by html2wiki
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:36): Maybe I'll use a Perl module for that.
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:36): There are a few good ones on CPAN.
13d7d168f19c177db483c695588e476c (17:37): except I guess that keeps working after the last line... let me see
8bece2647a39db763401c1e98abe5854 (17:37): I'd use gq selectively I think.
13d7d168f19c177db483c695588e476c (17:39): oh, and I left out the j
13d7d168f19c177db483c695588e476c (17:39): I supppose I should test this stuff before messaging it :)
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:39): Why does vim add an extra "*"?
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:39): I guess it's some misbehaviour that can be remedied.
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:39): Well, I'll just Text::Format or whatever.
bbfe187fc48d9171af3b60d269c8b407 (17:40): Is it possible to write vim functions in anything else save for vimscript?
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:41): tralala: they may still be second class citizens, though.
3887a67e94d6cf114c99849d3961a031 (17:42): hi! i've picked up a habit of using :bd to get rid of stuff... but this is annoying to because it closes the current window/tab...
3887a67e94d6cf114c99849d3961a031 (17:42): is there a better command than bd?
6b631686ce120abfa195e225d0d7341f (17:42): How do i find the curly brace that matches the one that I'm currently on? Does vi have that funtionality?
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (17:42): rindolf: ah.. you're a vim-type too
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:42): tralala: I mean that there are some things, you'll need to do in vimscript from within them.
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:43): LeoNerd: yes. I swear by vim.
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:43): LeoNerd: sometimes at night when I'm somewhere between being awake and sleepy, I used to feel like I'm sitting in front of a gvim window entering commands.
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:44): LeoNerd: but I'm not really a gvim guru.
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:44): Even Bram Moolenaar probably doesn't use 100% of vim.
bbfe187fc48d9171af3b60d269c8b407 (17:44): At work where I have to use winxp I always keep agvim
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:44): Which reminds me that I'd like to donate some money to ICCF-Holland.
bbfe187fc48d9171af3b60d269c8b407 (17:44): gvim running to give me strenght :)
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:45): Out of appreciation for vim and gvim.
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:45): tralala: I started to use gvim on Windows. Ironically.
bbfe187fc48d9171af3b60d269c8b407 (17:45): so where's the help for functions in python?
2259f65ded2b02851864d15ede8b4eff (17:46): tralala: make sure this plug-in is compiled.
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (17:46): ^-- I wonder how much you'd fit in one of these, if it covered all of vim. :)
